div.p: Melvin: Hey.
Nancy: Oh, morning.
Melvin: What’re you up to?
Nancy: Oh, just wrapping up a few things here.
Nancy: Please, have a seat. What’re you avoiding?
Melvin: Nothing, I just wanted to stop by and say good morning. Say, did you hear about Foster?
Nancy: No, what happened?
Melvin: You didn’t hear?
Nancy: No, is everything OK?
Melvin: He’s fine. I mean, fine for him. But, he lost it yesterday.
Nancy: He lost it?
Melvin: Yeah, he totally yelled at somebody.
Nancy: (surprised) Yelled?
Melvin: Well, OK, he raised his voice a little bit.
Nancy: At who?
Melvin: Uh, it was at me.
Nancy: (laughing) Ha. No wonder, of course it was. What did you do?
Melvin: Nothing, I just asked him if he could help me out with something. I think he’s a little overwhelmed right now.
Melvin: He said he’s gonna quit if they don’t find somebody soon.
Nancy: Yeah, I know they’ve been working on getting someone to help.
Melvin: Yeah, but the whole process has taken about four months, and I think he’s getting fed up.
Nancy: Yeah. So what happened?
Melvin: Oh, nothing, I talked to him, calmed him down. I’ve got a way with people.
